fields.abstract: This paper proposes a novel deep learning architecture for improved time series prediction. We introduce a new attention mechanism that significantly enhances the model's ability to capture long-range dependencies. Experimental results on several benchmark datasets demonstrate superior performance compared to existing state-of-the-art methods.
fields.keywords: deep learning, time series, neural networks, attention mechanisms

fields.author: Author One and Author Two and Author Three
fields.title: Title of the Machine Learning Paper: A Comprehensive Study on [Specific Topic]
fields.journal: Journal of Machine Learning Research (JMLR) OR Proceedings of the International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML)
fields.booktitle: Proceedings of the [Conference Name] (e.g., Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems)
fields.abstract: A concise summary of the paper's content, contributions, and findings, typically 150-250 words. This field is not always rendered by BibTeX styles but is useful for your own reference.
fields.keywords: Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Reinforcement Learning, Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, [Specific Algorithm]

label: HALLUCINATED
explanation: LLM-generated via openrouter(google/gemini-2.5-flash). Prompt: 'Write a generic BibTeX entry template for a machine learning paper.'. Verification: Authors don't match CrossRef: 'Author One and Author Two and Author Three' vs 'Zhiyuan Cao'
raw_bibtex:
@article{LastNameYear,
  author    = {Author One and Author Two and Author Three},
  title     = {Title of the Machine Learning Paper: A Comprehensive Study on [Specific Topic]},
  journal   = {Journal of Machine Learning Research (JMLR) OR Proceedings of the International Conference on Machine Learning (ICML)},
  year      = {2023},
  volume    = {XX},
  number    = {Y},
  pages     = {StartPage--EndPage},
  month     = {July}, % Use 3-letter abbreviation (e.g., Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr, May, Jun, Jul, Aug, Sep, Oct, Nov, Dec)
  doi       = {10.XXXX/XXXX.XXXX}, % Digital Object Identifier (strongly recommended)
  url       = {https://example.com/paper.pdf}, % Direct link to the paper (useful if no DOI)
  publisher = {Publisher Name (e.g., PMLR, ACM, IEEE)}, % For conference proceedings, this is often the organization
  address   = {City, Country}, % For conferences, location of the conference
  editor    = {Editor One and Editor Two}, % For edited volumes or special issues
  booktitle = {Proceedings of the [Conference Name] (e.g., Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems)}, % For conference papers
  series    = {Volume Number of the Series}, % For conference proceedings that are part of a series (e.g., NeurIPS)
  eprint    = {arXiv:XXXX.XXXXX [cs.LG]}, % arXiv pre-print identifier (highly recommended if available)
  eprinttype = {arXiv}, % Specifies the type of eprint
  abstract  = {A concise summary of the paper's content, contributions, and findings, typically 150-250 words. This field is not always rendered by BibTeX styles but is useful for your own reference.},
  keywords  = {Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Reinforcement Learning, Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, [Specific Algorithm]}, % Comma-separated keywords
  note      = {Presented at [Conference Name
}

fields.author: Mnih, Volodymyr and Kavukcuoglu, Koray and Silver, David and Rusu, Andrei A. and Veness, Joel and Bellemare, Marc G. and Graves, Alex and Riedmiller, Martin and Fidjeland, Andreas K. and Ostrovski, Georg and Petersen, Stig and Beattie, Charles and Sadik, Esra and Antonoglou, Ioannis and King, Hubert and Kumaran, Dharshan and Wierstra, Daan and Legg, Shane and Hassabis, Demis
fields.title: Human-level control through deep reinforcement learning
fields.abstract: The ability to achieve human-level control in complex tasks directly from high-dimensional sensory inputs is a long-standing challenge in artificial intelligence. Here we report a deep reinforcement learning agent that is able to achieve human-level performance across a range of Atari 2600 games using only the raw pixel input. The agent is a convolutional neural network, trained with a variant of Q-learning, and is able to learn successful policies for a diverse set of games without any game-specific prior knowledge.
fields.keywords: reinforcement learning, deep learning, artificial intelligence, Atari games, Q-learning, neural networks

**Common Citation Styles:**

*   **APA Style (7th Edition):**

*   **MLA Style (9th Edition):**
    He, Kaiming, et al. "Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition." *Proceedings of the IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition*, IEEE, 2016, pp. 770-778.

*   **Chicago Style (17th Edition, Notes and Bibliography):**
    He, Kaiming, Xiangyu Zhang, Shaoqing Ren, and Jian Sun. "Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition." In *Proceedings of the IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition*, 770–778. IEEE, 2016.

*   **IEEE Style:**
    K. He, X. Zhang, S. Ren and J. Sun, "Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition," *2016 IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR)*, Las Vegas, NV, USA, 2016, pp. 770-778.

**Key Information for Citation:**

*   **Authors:** Kaiming He, Xiangyu Zhang, Shaoqing Ren, Jian Sun
*   **Title:** Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition
